name: Islamic Relief USA
mission:
Islamic Relief USA provides relief and development in a dignified manner regardless of gender, race, or religion, and works to empower individuals in their communities and give them a voice in the world.

Incorporated in 1993 in California, Islamic Relief USA has provided humanitarian support in the United States and internationally for nearly 30 years.
theoryOfChange: States that contributions provide immediate relief (food, water, medical aid, shelter) and also support long-term solutions such as community development, water wells, skills training, women launching small businesses, and helping children return to school, with the goal of creating a world free of poverty.

evaluationSources: BBB Wise Giving Alliance Standards for Charity Accountability

zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://irusa.org/zakat (Source: https://irusa.org/zakat)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Strong donor fit, low risk profile, and credible supporting evidence for outcomes.

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Strong humanitarian service (+4)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 44/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; good program ratio (≥75%) suggests reasonable delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: If reserves are above policy target, document why and publish triggers for planned deployment.
components.name: Financial Health

score_details.score_summary: Islamic Relief USA shows exceptional alignment and strong impact, with zakat compliance.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://irusa.org/zakat (Source: https://irusa.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: Islamic Relief USA holds a 100.0/100 score and maintains a program expense ratio of 80.3%.
The charity is zakat-eligible and follows specific asnaf categories for fund distribution.
Total revenue for the period was $165,235,589.
The organization supports forcibly displaced families in Sudan and provides aid via Bahri Hospital.
Programs include the rehabilitation of Bahri Hospital and fortification of the Palestinian medical sector.
The organization provides multiple donation options and giving methods for supporters.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a high overall rating due to its exceptional financial transparency, perfect third-party accountability scores, and strong alignment with the needs of Muslim donors.
areas_for_improvement: Enhancing the directness of impact reporting for specific domestic programs to match the detail of international medical interventions.

dimension_explanations.alignment: Islamic Relief USA shows high donor fit for those seeking humanitarian causes, offering clear zakat-eligible donation pathways and addressing urgent global crises [2][6]. Its long track record of serving vulnerable families across the United States and abroad reinforces its mission-driven alignment [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high effectiveness by directing 80.3% of its $165,235,589 total revenue toward programs [1][3]. Its direct service model is evidenced by specific outcomes, such as the rehabilitation of Bahri Hospital and the fortification of the Palestinian medical sector [4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: Islamic Relief USA provides comprehensive humanitarian aid and poverty alleviation programs both domestically and internationally.
strengths: Maintains a perfect Charity Navigator score of 100.0/100, reflecting top-tier accountability and transparency.
Strong financial health with 18.0 months of working capital and a high program expense ratio of 80.3%.
Highly efficient fundraising operations, spending only $0.17 per $1 raised.
baseline_narrative.summary: Islamic Relief USA is a non-profit organization dedicated to creating a world free of poverty through emergency response and sustainable development [4]. The organization is officially zakat-eligible, maintaining a dedicated policy to ensure funds reach specific asnaf categories in accordance with Islamic principles [2].

all_citations.claim: 100,000 direct people served via Bahri Hospital

donor_fit_matrix.evidence_rigor: Grade C - Verified outcomes and strong theory of change

rich_narrative.headline: Islamic Relief USA provides comprehensive humanitarian aid and poverty alleviation programs both domestically and internationally.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fulfill zakat obligations through a large-scale, established humanitarian organization with a proven track record of global emergency response.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations with confidence
Prefer supporting large, established institutions with global reach
Value high financial efficiency and transparency ratings
giving_considerations: Large-scale operations mean individual gifts join a massive pooled fund
Programs operate in complex international crisis zones
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking hyperlocal community impact or those who require rigorous academic RCT evidence of effectiveness.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The charity tracks outcome metrics and has a documented theory of change, but lacks rigorous third-party RCT evaluations.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: The organization provides direct humanitarian relief and sustainable development to alleviate poverty and respond to emergencies.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that humanitarian interventions are actually improving lives and not causing unintended harm in vulnerable communities.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a massive international humanitarian organization responding to ongoing global crises, they have significant capacity to absorb additional funding.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Global (United States, Asia, Europe, Africa, South America)

strengths.detail: The organization maintains a <cite id="5">100/100 overall score</cite> from Charity Navigator, indicating top-tier governance and transparency.
Operations are highly efficient, with an <cite id="4">80.3% program expense ratio</cite> and a fundraising efficiency of <cite id="7">$0.17 per $1 raised</cite>.
The charity holds <cite id="8">18.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant stability for long-term humanitarian interventions.

strengths_deep_dive: Islamic Relief USA demonstrates robust financial and operational health. The organization reported <cite id="3">$165,235,589 in total revenue</cite> with a <cite id="9">10.0% 3-year revenue CAGR</cite>, indicating steady growth. Their commitment to efficiency is evident in their <cite id="4">80.3% program expense ratio</cite> and low fundraising costs of <cite id="7">$0.17 per $1 raised</cite>. Furthermore, the charity holds a PLATINUM Seal of Transparency from Candid and a <cite id="5">100/100 overall score</cite> from Charity Navigator.
rich_narrative.summary: Islamic Relief USA is a large-scale humanitarian organization founded in <cite id="1">1994</cite> that provides emergency relief and development programs globally. The organization is <cite id="2">ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE</cite> and directs funds to specific asnaf categories. In 2023, the charity reported <cite id="3">$165,235,589 in total revenue</cite> and maintained an <cite id="4">80.3% program expense ratio</cite>. The organization demonstrates strong financial health and accountability, earning a <cite id="5">100/100 overall score</cite> from Charity Navigator. Its programs have significant reach, including <cite id="6">100,000 direct people served via Bahri Hospital</cite>.
